articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Lodging Quarters of Participants in Meeting of Primary Organization Cadres
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit Lodging Quarters of Participants in Meeting of Primary Organization Cadres
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials visited the lodging quarters of the participants of the 4th meeting of primary organization cadres of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League on Monday. 
					 Kim Yong Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the youth league, and officials concerned visited the lodging quarters and met with the participants in the meeting.
					
					 They congratulated the primary organization cadres who set examples in the work during the past period.
					
					 The senior officials requested them to give fuller play to the bravery, unity and militancy in defending the country and building a thriving nation by inheriting the heroic fighting spirit of the revolutionary fallen fighters and forerunners.

articles.title: Talks Held between FMs of DPRK and Iran
articles.content:
Talks Held between FMs of DPRK and Iran
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Talks between DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong and Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif were held at the building of the Iranian Foreign Ministry on September 14. Ri is participating in the 53rd meeting of Asian-African Legal Consultative Organization to be held in Iran and paying an official goodwill visit to Iran.
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were the party of the foreign minister, the DPRK ambassador to Iran and his embassy official and from the Iranian side were those concerned of the Foreign Ministry.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly relations between the two countries in various fields.

articles.title: DPRK Public Health Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Public Health Delegation Back Home
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK public health delegation headed by Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk returned home Monday after taking part in the 32nd meeting of health ministers of Southeastern Asian regional countries of WHO and its 67th General Assembly held in Dhaka, Bangladesh.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations, Delegates Arrive
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations, Delegates Arrive
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Foreign delegations and delegates arrived here on Monday to take part in the 9th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair.
					 They included a delegation of the Far Eastern branch of the Academy of Sciences of Russia, a delegation of the Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, a delegation of the Russian Foundation for Humanities, a delegation of the Choson Exchange Association in Singapore, a delegation of the Association for Promotion of Development of Chinese Culture, a delegation of the Liaoning Provincial Association for International Friendly Contact of China, a delegation of the State Administration of Press and Publication, Radio, Film and Television of China, a delegate of Waikato Institute of Technology of New Zealand, a delegate of the American Association for the Advancement of Science and a delegate of the Environmental Education Media Project.
					
					 Earlier arriving here were a delegation of the Pugwash Conference on Science and World Affairs, a delegation of the Russkiy Mir Foundation of Russia, a delegation of the Library of Yanbian University of China, a delegation of Publishers of the Yanbian Korean Autonomous Region, a delegation of the Haihua Group of China, a delegation of the Trans-Pacific Enterprise Expeditors and a delegate of the U.S branch of the Korean Friendship Association.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestlers Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestlers Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- DPRK wrestlers returned home Monday after taking part in the 2014 World Wrestling Championships held in Tashkent, Uzbekistan.
					 Yang Kyong Il placed the first in the men's 57kg freestyle category and Kim Hyon Gyong and Jong Myong Suk bagged bronze medals in the women's 48kg and 53kg freestyle categories. 
					
					 The wrestlers were greeted at Pyongyang Railway Station by Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, officials concerned, students of Kim Il Sung University and families.

articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The participants of the 4th meeting of primary organization carders of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Monday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK Cabinet Gives Reception for World Wrestling Champion
articles.content:
DPRK Cabinet Gives Reception for World Wrestling Champion
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's Cabinet gave a reception at Okryu Restaurant Monday in honor of Yang Kyong Il who won a gold medal at the 2014 World Wrestling Championship.
					 Present at the reception were Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Minister of Physical Culture and Sports Kim Yong Hun, and officials concerned, and players and coaches and Yang's family.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin, addressing the reception, congratulated Yang on bagging a gold medal by playing the match with the grit and pluck instilled into him by the party and thereby pleasing supreme leader Kim Jong Un and demonstrating the dignity and honor of the country before the world.
					
					 He said that Yang owed his success to the wise leadership and deep loving care of Kim Jong Un who is energetically guiding the nation's sports.
					
					 Yang in his reply extended profound thanks to Kim Jong Un for showing deep love for him though he just fulfilled his duty.
					
					 He renewed his firm determination to win every match by training hard, always bearing in mind the expectation of the party towards the sportspersons.

articles.title: Reception Given by Charge D'affaires A. I. of Malaysian Embassy
articles.content:
Reception Given by Charge D'affaires A. I. of Malaysian Embassy
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Ilham Tuah Bin Illias, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Malaysian embassy here, gave a reception Monday on the occasion of the national day of Malaysia.
					 Present there on invitation were Ri Kil Song, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Mun Jae Chol, vice-director of the General Bureau for Affairs with Diplomatic Corps, officials concerned and foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Staff members of the Malaysian embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: DPRK-France Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
DPRK-France Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The exhibition of relics, jointly surveyed and discovered by the DPRK and France in Kaesong Walls, opened at the Korean Folklore Museum on Monday under the co-sponsorship of the Guidance Bureau for the Preservation of National Heritages and the French Far-east School.
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Ryong Ju, director of the guidance bureau, officials concerned, teachers and students of Kim Il Sung University, researchers of the Academy of Social Sciences, Elisabeth Chabanol, representative of French Far-east School, Emmanuel Rousseau, director of the Cooperation Bureau of France in DPRK, and Charlie Li Quanhua, representative of the Lafarge S.A. of France.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys and members of the missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremony.
					
					 They went round the relics discovered by the guidance bureau and the French Far-east School in the course of the joint survey of the Kaesong Walls for some years and photos clearly proving the history of Kaesong, the capital of Koryo which was the first unified state in the history of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Russian Figure on Development of Russia-DPRK Friendship and Cooperation
articles.content:
Russian Figure on Development of Russia-DPRK Friendship and Cooperation
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Andrei Strygin, president of the Russian National Philatelists Academy, was interviewed by KCNA on September 13 after participating in the stamp show of philatelists of the DPRK and Russia held here on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 He said that he came to know well about the creative wisdom and resourcefulness of the Korean people and the might of the self-supporting national economy while going round various places of Pyongyang.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The Korean people built lots of monumental structures in various places.
					
					 I visited many countries of the world in the past but the streets of Pyongyang look as modern as those of other countries.
					
					 The Munsu Water Park alone is enough to show well the efforts of the government to improve the people's living standard.
					
					 The outdoor wading pool and comprehensive indoor wading pool were crowded with people and cheerful laughter was heard from there.
					
					 Expressing boundless reverence for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, he continued:
					
					 We visited the statues of the great leaders of the DPRK on Mansu Hill and paid tribute to them on the threshold of the birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 Seeing an endless stream of people from all walks of life, service personnel and children visit the statues of the President and Kim Jong Il and pay tribute to them that day, we could realize the boundless reverence of the Korean people for the preceding leaders.
					
					 We are mulling doing work for friendship and cooperation with the DPRK on various occasions in the wake of this show.
					
					 We intend to open an international stamp show of philatelists and issue common stamps in Russia this year marking the 66th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between Russia and the DPRK as a part of the work for boosting the friendly relations between Russia and the DPRK.
					
					 We will make positive efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between Russia and the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Team Advances into Semifinals at 2014 AFC U-16 Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Team Advances into Semifinals at 2014 AFC U-16 Championship
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team advanced into the semifinals at the 2014 AFC U-16 Championship which started in Thailand on September 6.
					 The championship brought together teams from 16 countries and regions. Divided into four groups, teams will play league matches and winners and runners-up from each group will play knockout games.
					
					 Four teams which will prove successful in the current championship will participate in the FIFA U-17 World Cup to be held in 2015 on behalf of Asia.
					
					 The DPRK team belonging to Group C played matches with teams of Kuwait, Nepal and Uzbekistan.
					
					 On September 14 the DPRK team played quarter finals with its Iranian rival. The DPRK eleven beat its Iranian rival 4:2 in the 11 meter penalty kick at the end of the draw in the first and second halves of the match.

articles.title: DPRK Football Team Beats Its Chinese Rival in Asian Games
articles.content:
DPRK Football Team Beats Its Chinese Rival in Asian Games
 Inchon, September 15 (KCNA-Correspondent) -- League matches of men's football of the 17th Asian Games started.
					 29 teams were divided into 8 groups. The winner and the runner-up of each group will play knockout games. 
					
					 The DPRK team along with Chinese and Pakistani rivals belong to Group F. 
					
					 The DPRK team played its first game with Chinese rival on Monday. 
					
					 Sim Hyon Jin of the DPRK scored the first goal in the 9th minute of the match. 
					
					 So Kyong Jin of the DPRK team scored the second goal in the 46th minute and Ri Hyok Chol third goal in the 56th minute of the match.
					
					 The DPRK trounced its Chinese rival 3:0.
					
					 The DPRK eleven will play its second match with its Pakistani rival on September 18.

articles.title: International Scientific Symposium to Be Held Hereã€€
articles.content:
International Scientific Symposium to Be Held Here
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- An international scientific symposium of Kim Il Sung University will be held between September 23 and 24 under the theme "Linguistics, Literature and Historical Science of Korea".
					 Published there will be significant research successes made in correctly understanding Korea's excellent language, literary legacy and time-honored history.
					
					 It will bring together prestigious educators and scientists of various countries including the DPRK and Russia.
					
					 The symposium sponsored by Kim Il Sung University will mark a significant occasion in promoting exchange and cooperation among universities and research institutes of different countries and contributing to developing education and science.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Stamp Bureau issued a stamp showing Tok Islet of Korea.
					 Tok Islet has been an inseparable part of Korean territory the world recognizes in view of history and international law.
					
					 The islet, located in eastern tip of Korea, was found and developed by the Korean ancestors before the 5th-6th centuries. This fact was proven by old geographies and maps of Korea and Japan.
					
					 The stamp shows a geographical map of Tok Islet on which printed are rocks surrounding the west and east islets.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Increasing Speed of General Advance
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Increasing Speed of General Advance 
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- It is an important task facing the field of party ideological work to bring about a steady surge in the revolutionary spirit of all the service personnel and people through the intensive ideological offensive and glorify this year as a year of great change, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an editorial.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The ideological work is an uninterrupted work itself.
					
					 Any vacuum in the ideological work would cause a blank in the minds of the people, thus allowing evil ideas to infiltrate into their minds.
					
					 There can be a campaign in the economic work, but such work style should never be allowed in the ideological education.
					
					 Great progress is being achieved in the drive this year to build an economic power and improve the people's living standard through the dynamic ideological campaign under the leadership of the great party.
					
					 Different fields and units of the national economy are making a dynamic advance, bringing about a fresh leap forward. Agricultural workers across the country have waged a drive to increase grain production even under the difficult situation and unfavorable climate conditions.
					
					 A dynamic drive for creating the new Korean speed is now under way at important construction sites including power stations in tiers on the Chongchon River, stockbreeding base in Sepho area, Wisong Scientists Street and apartment houses for educators of Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					 It is necessary to consolidate and expand the successes already achieved to attain at any cost the militant goals set by the party this year. To this end, it is necessary to intensify the ideological offensive to give full play to the mental power of the masses.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Escalate Confrontation with DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Escalate Confrontation with DPRK 
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Despite the DPRK's consistent efforts for the improvement of the north-south relations, a breakthrough has not yet been made toward dialogue. This is entirely attributable to the south Korean puppet forces' vicious moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 Accusing the south Korean authorities of blocking dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south through frantic moves for confrontation, the article goes on:
					
					 The DPRK side's delegation to the north-south high-level contact urged the south Korean authorities to show sincerity for improving the north-south ties by putting an end to the confrontation campaign such as anti-DPRK balloon operations.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces should neither deceive the public through the hypocritical talk about "dialogue" nor resort to such foolish act as trying to shift the blame on to the DPRK.
					
					 Such act is not helpful to defusing mistrust and confrontation between the north and the south but will only push the bilateral ties to a more serious phase.
					
					 Dialogue can never go together with confrontation.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities are truly interested in the north-south dialogue, they should take a bold decision to respect and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, put an end to the north-targeted joint military exercises and eliminate legal and institutional mechanisms that stand in the way of achieving reunification.
					
					 Doing so would be the first step for opening the door of dialogue.

articles.title: S. Korean Figure Calls for Achieving National Reconciliation and Defusing Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korean Figure Calls for Achieving National Reconciliation and Defusing Confrontation
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The representative of the south Korean internet paper Jaju Minbo said at the trial held by the puppet Seoul Central District Court authorities on September 12 that the way for the Korean nation to achieve reunification without shedding blood is to implement the inter-Korean agreements including the July 4 joint statement and the June 15 joint declaration.
					 He said that it is painful that the Korean nation remains divided for a long time due to foreign forces, calling for putting an end to such disastrous tragedy as early as possible.
					
					 He said he had worked with one mind that he would contribute to achieving the cherished desire of the fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Candlelight Meeting Held in Demand of Institution of Special Law on Ferry Sewol
articles.content:
Candlelight Meeting Held in Demand of Institution of Special Law on Ferry Sewol
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A candlelight meeting demanding the institution of a special law on the ferry Sewol took place at the Kwanghwamun Plaza, Seoul on Sep. 13, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People.
					 Attending it were members of organizations of professors, teachers and students of universities including the Teachers Union, the Council of Professors for Democracy and the Association of Students for Democratic and Independent Reunification.
					
					 The participants in a resolution declared they would carry on their actions till the special law is instituted to probe the truth behind the disaster. 
					
					 They referred to the ceaseless signature campaign and demonstration being staged in the university street.
					
					 They noted that professors, teachers and students of universities would stand in the van of the struggle together with the bereaved families now on their hunger strike in demand of the institution of a special law on the ferry which will grant the rights to investigate and indict those responsible for the disaster.
					
					 Bereaved families denounced the chief executive and the ruling party for persistently keeping mum about their hunger strike and their demand for the institution of a special law and falsifying the truth.

articles.title: DPRK Birthday Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Birthday Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Receptions, friendly meetings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows to celebrate the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK took place at the DPRK missions in Russia, India, Nepal, Malaysia, Bangladesh, Poland, the Czech Republic, Bulgaria, Germany, Britain, Switzerland, Sweden, France, Algeria, DR Congo, Ethiopia and Mexico and the DPRK permanent mission in the UN Office and international organizations in Geneva and the DPRK permanent mission in the UN from Sept. 4 to 8.
					 Displayed there were photos documenting the undying exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display were works of the peerless great persons of Mt. Paektu and books and photos introducing the proud history of the DPRK. 
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Pyongyang Today" and "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation".
					
					 The vice governor of the Maritime Territory Administration of Russia said the good neighborly relations between the peoples of Russia and the DPRK with a long tradition of friendship and cooperation are growing stronger as the days go by. 
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) said the DPRK serves as a beacon of hope for the world progressive people as it has achieved eye-opening successes in socialist construction under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un despite all sorts of sanctions and blockade by the hostile forces. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain expressed the belief that the Korean people would surely build a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un who is identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association said the foundation of the DPRK gave great strength and courage to the world progressives struggling for national independence against colonialism and imperialism.

articles.title: Foreign Newspapers Observe DPRK's Founding Anniversary
articles.content:
Foreign Newspapers Observe DPRK's Founding Anniversary
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers dedicated special write-ups to the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The September 5th issue of the Thai newspaper Xing San Daily allotted one whole page to an article titled "Invincible power" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It noted that Korea, once eclipsed on the world map, could demonstrate its dignity and might as an invincible power which no one dares to provoke as the DPRK was founded.
					
					 It said that the DPRK is dynamically advancing to become a power in the fields of economy, science, technology and sports while consolidating its position as a political, ideological and military power.
					
					 On the same day the Nepalese newspaper Arpan carried an article which said as follows.
					
					 Kim Il Sung, founder of the DPRK, turned it into a prospering socialist country.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il firmly consolidated the DPRK into an invincible socialist power.
					
					 The invincibility of the DPRK could be seen through the events which drew the world attention toward the end of the last century.
					
					 The DPRK defended socialism despite the worst adversities when socialism collapsed in various countries and imperialists' offensive against socialism became all the more vicious.
					
					 The Nigerian newspaper Nigerian Observer on Sept. 4 carried an article introducing the DPRK which is demonstrating its might as a socialist power.
					
					 It said: The DPRK's might as an invincible socialist power is being further displayed thanks to supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Under his leadership the DPRK's capabilities for self-defence are being bolstered up and its army and people are making a new history of victory in the showdown with the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK will shine long as an invincible socialist power.

articles.title: DPRK Founding Anniversary Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Founding Anniversary Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Institutions and organizations of different countries issued bulletins from Aug. 27 to Sept. 5 on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Kim Jong Il Library in Ecuador and the Juche Youth Group in Ecuador carried articles titled "Invincible socialist power" and "Fortress of independence" and the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea an article titled "Great Juche idea and DPRK".
					
					 The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship carried an article titled "Scientists Street in Pyongyang" and others.
					
					 Articles dealt with the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who built the independent socialist state centered on the popular masses and handed down the firm foundation for eternal prosperity of the country and nation as their heritage.
					
					 They also lauded supreme leader Kim Jong Un for adding shines to state-building exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and wisely leading the army and people of the DPRK to the road of independence, Songun and socialism.
					
					 The above-said institutions and organizations posted bulletins on their websites.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassies 
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Foreign delegations and figures visited DPRK embassies in relevant countries from Sept. 5 to 10 on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They included the delegation of the Ministry of Royal Palace of Cambodia, delegation of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, chamberlain of the Presidency of Egypt, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Bangladesh Communist Party, president of Bangladesh People's League, chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy and the chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association who is member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria.
					
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute said that the 66 year-long history of the DPRK is a proud one of victory in which the Korean people built the socialist state centered on the popular masses and turned it into an invincible political, ideological and military power by smashing all aggression moves and challenges of the imperialists under the leadership of the President and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association who is member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria said:
					
					 I sincerely congratulate the Korean people on having registered big successes in their efforts to build an economic power and improve the people's living standard under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un despite the moves of the U.S.-led imperialists to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 I hope that everything will go well in the DPRK.
					
					 I am sure that Korea's reunification will be achieved in an independent and peaceful way free from any foreign interference in the near future and reunified Korea will demonstrate its might as a world power.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies in Foreign Countries
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Foreign governments, political parties, organizations, institutions and figures sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassies in relevant countries on Sept. 4 and 9 on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They included the Committee for External Affairs of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, Myanmar foreign ministry, Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, International Commerce Promotion Center of Myanmar, Myanmar Medical Research Institute, a Myanmar hotel, Eternal Flower Co. Ltd. of Myanmar, Workers' Party of Mexico, People's Socialist Party of Mexico, Mexican Friend Association for Memory of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee and chairman of the Committee for External Affairs of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party who doubles as vice-prime minister and foreign minister of Laos, the minister of Information, Culture and Tourism and the vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the National Construction Front of Laos who doubles as chairman of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					 Floral baskets sent by them were laid before portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and full-length paintings depicting them.
					
					 Meanwhile, Russian, Chinese, Vietnamese, Lao, Indian, Indonesian, Brunei, Philippine, Kuwaiti, Saudi Arabian, Cambodian, Pakistani, Singaporean, Nepalese, Thai, Bangladeshi and Egyptian embassies in Myanmar sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in that country.

articles.title: Cuadros de partido y Estado visitaron hospedaje de participantes en IV Conferencia
articles.content:
Cuadros de partido y Estado visitaron hospedaje de participantes en IV Conferencia
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Los cuadros del partido y el Estado visitaron el dia 15 el hospedaje de los participantes en la IV Conferencia de los Funcionarios de Organizacion de Base de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung.
					Kim Yong Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jon Yong Nam, presidente del Comite Central de Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, y otros funcionarios se encontraron con los participantes.
					
					Felicitaron a los funcionarios de las organizaciones de base que resultaron ejemplares en sus trabajos.
					
					Les encomendaron que al continuar el espiritu de lucha heroica de los martires revolucionarios y los predecesores, demuestren mas valentia, unidad y combatividad de los jovenes coreanos en la defensa de la patria y la causa de construccion de un Estado prospero.

articles.title: Kang Sok Ju se reune con secretario general de partido politico de Suiza
articles.content:
Kang Sok Ju se reune con secretario general de partido politico de Suiza
						
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar las conversaciones entre el miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kang Sok Ju, quien preside la delegacion del PTC de visita en Suiza desde el dia 11 hasta el 13, y el secretario general del Partido Popular Democratico Cristiano de Suiza, Beatrice Wertli Meierhans.
					Tambien Kang departio respectivamente con el secretario de Estado del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, Yves Rossier, y el ex presidente de la Confederacion Suiza, Pascal Couchepin.
					
					En las ocasiones se realizo el intercambio de opiniones sobre el problema de ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los partidos y los gobiernos de ambos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					Por otra parte, la delegacion del PTC departio con la delegacion de los politicos de diferentes partidos politicos de Europa.

articles.title: Enjuiciado en RPDC el estadounidense Miller Matthew Todd
articles.content:
Enjuiciado en RPDC el estadounidense Miller Matthew Todd
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el 14 de septiembre en el Tribunal Supremo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea el juicio sobre el norteamericano Miller Matthew Todd quien cometio actos hostiles anti-RPDC al entrar en el pais en abril pasado como turista.
					El fue condenado a 6 anos de trabajos reeducativos.

articles.title: Consejo de Ministros ofrece banquete en honor de campeon Yang Kyong Il
articles.content:
Consejo de Ministros ofrece banquete en honor de campeon Yang Kyong Il
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 15 en el Restaurante Okryu un banquete en honor de Yang Kyong Il quien se corono campeon en el Campeonato Mundial de Lucha 2014.
					En la recepcion estuvieron presentes el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el ministro de Deportes Kim Yong Hun, y otros funcionarios, los jugadores, entrenadores y familiares.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, el vicepremier felicito al nuevo campeon mundial quien complacio al Mariscal Kim Jong Un al ganar la medalla de oro en el campeonato mundial compitiendo con la audacia infundida por el partido, y puso de pleno manifiesto a todo el mundo la dignidad y orgullo de la patria.
					
					El exito de Yang es un fruto de la sabia guia del Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien dirige energicamente las labores deportivas del pais.
					
					En el discurso de respuesta, Yang expreso agradecimiento al Mariscal que le dispensa benevolencias si bien el cumplio lo que debe hacer un deportista.
					
					Manifesto la firme decision de redoblar los ejercicios y lograr victorias sucesivas en los futuros juegos para no defraudar la esperanza del Partido depositada en los deportistas.
